answers.answer: Hi there!It is not normal but may be seen in cases of extreme stress/ psychological issues especially when compounded with other factors such as depression, neurogenic disorders peyronie's disease, body image issues, medications, alcohol, smoking, drugs/medications, hormonal imbalance, radiation therapy, kidney failure, metabolic disorders, multiple sclerosis, hypertension, diabetes, prostatitis, urethritis etc. At a primary level I would suggest being a bit relaxed about the situation and see if this seems to improve the condition. If you do not notice any improvement, it might be a good idea to consult a urologist for a detailed evaluation and appropriate management.Hope this helps.Take care!

question: Dear Drsis it normal to ejaculate uncontrollably when u get extremely mad.i am a very calm person who barely gets mad,but some time when i get extremely upset (usually hearing a very bad news that gets me mad) i don't know why but i start ejaculating and wet my pants and ejaculating a huge amounts. it happens to meet once a year when i get a really bad news usually about my spouseis this normal?
title: Uncontrolled ejaculation
